I have had this game for a while now, but didn't get into it until just recently. I became addicted to how unique the games were and how diverse the chases were. After watching a few videos and playing, I became somewhat decent at both killer and survivor (at about 30 hours put in). The only complaint would be the long killer que times at low ranks but the game is phenomenal otherwise.

----> new review : dead by daylight is an asymmetrical horror game centered around a team of 4 survivors trying to repair generators in order to activate an exit gate and escape the killer, the devs are proven to be all killers mains as they have all stated this themselves. they have "fixed" (fixed meaning, we changed it to make things easier for the killer rather than promoting skilled play so you can mouse 1 and win) : vaccuum pallets so survivors have a harder time getting away while keeping vaccuum hooks so survivors who are about to wiggle off the killers shoulder still get hooked anyway, safety windows so you can still hit them through the window from a mile away, they removed fatshaming spots for killers but left them for survivors, they nerfed hex totem spawns so they are harder for survivors to find, they have increased and buffed killer perks and removed or nerfed survivor perks.  so overall this game is a 0/10 because the devs have no interest in FAIR balancing and have no idea what they are doing i 100% think you would probably enjoy home sweet home survive more than this shit tier game............. i do not think they deserve youre money and even if you do give it to them you will be sorely dissappointed by the bullshit that they let happen

After 1.4k Hours, constantly grinding, and being treated with mediocre and very bad patches and content releases very many times in a row, and the developers constantly ignoring feedback from PTB's and just feedback in general, I can say that I have a love-hate relationship with this game right now.


There is bugs that still exist from YEARS ago, like during the first release. There is a new game breaking bug almost every patch, the developers support NFTs, the community is extremely split, toxic, and entitled... There is so much wrong and the developers had the chance to make it right. But today I draw the line. I'm uninstalling Dead By Daylight even after all the money and time I spent on this game. This game is like a toxic relationship, its not good for my mental health and its not fun anymore.. for various reasons. 

#1: SBMM (Skill-Based Match Making) doesn't actually measure your skill
Despite all the backlash, DBD still caters to its newer players, and the new player experience. They could give less of a shit about people who have played the game for a long time. So what do they do? Despite having NO CLEAR WIN CONDITION, AND THE GAME BEING SUPER UNBALANCED AT HIGH LEVEL, they still add a system that measures "skill". The main reason this doesn't work is because lets say you run the killer the whole game, or have really short chases as killer but they all escape, OR you die on hook but everyone else escapes. SBMM doesn't care, you lose MMR anyways. It also doesn't count for No One Escapes Death, or 4 DS Unbreakables, or broken map offerings, or keys, or OP iri add-ons... None of it. 

#2: The game is extremely grindy when it doesn't need to be 
There are 185 perks in this game, each with 3 tiers. There is 28 Survivors, and around 24 Killers. That is 52 characters, each with their own levels, bloodwebs, and perks you need to grind in order to get good builds. On average you are spending over a million bloodpoints to max out a character. This will take you an unreasonable amount of time to do even with bloodpoint offerings, events, and BBQ/WGLF (bloodpoint multiplier perks). It takes way too many matches.. Good luck grinding for THAT long. Because even if you reach the max level on all characters.. you can still prestige for pretty much nothing good LMAO!!!

#3: The devs don't care, don't listen, and are greedy AF. 
This one is pretty self explanatory but the developers literally taunt their own community sometimes, on multiple occasions. Just watch a couple dev streams, you'll see what I mean. They've done it in their Anniversary event loading screens, they've done it in the forums... It's a joke. Also realize how every good perk is locked behind Paid DLC, how expensive the cosmetics are, how grindy the rift is, and how scarce they are with events lately.. It's extremely sad to see. This isn't a F2P GAME, BHVR!! Theres been a rise in hackers as well, and we still don't see very much happening on their end! It's almost like.. they don't care!!

#4: The community is toxic and super entitled 
If you play the wrong killer, run the wrong build, don't play in a way that someone likes, run a build thats too strong, run a build thats too weak, make simple mistakes... you are gonna get harassed, or the opposing team will disconnect, almost ALWAYS! Then you get called slurs in the end game chat, or get BM'd or something in game over the way you play. DBD players act like they are entitled to their wins, never want to actually improve, and complain about shit being "OP" when it isn't. The entitlement, the salt, is seriously a huge problem in this community and its such a headache. There is rarely any heart felt moments in this game, its either sweat or be sweated on, especially at high MMR and its NOT FUN! Who would've thought. 

That's only a couple reasons but this pretty much sums it up. This... Plus the recent NFT shit, All of this shit over time.. I'm just done, man. I give up. This game is just terrible. For your own mental health.. don't play it.

Great game, I really enjoy playing this game with my friends, solo que is a bit pissing me off, but with team of 4 the game is pure fun! 
Two things that I don't like: PB Farming Killers, Tunneling- and; tryharding Killers (focusing on one survivor or camping by hook) 
I also don't like the rank system, I am currently a rank 8 and get teammates with rank 18,19 or 20 :P
And it's also hard to rank up sometimes i don't get a rank-point even with 20k score LOL

I recommend the game and bet developers for more new maps type lab, with many gate that you can open by doing gens or just better (not boring maps) etc.

I am so tired of the toxic killers. Teammates started DC'ing so why waste my time, I DC'ed as well. Now I am stuck with a 14 minute timeout. SERIOUSLY?! I don't know any other game that punishes their players this severely. Now I here I am writing this review during my timeout for getting bullied in their game to express how frustrating I find this. Sounds like they are hoping to kill off their community. Lets be real here, the ranking system has ZERO value and the Dev's are delusional for thinking it is a super competitive game. It's not, it is mostly toxic players using meta builds the steam roll in points. 

Speaking of points, it is totally off balance and completely in favor of the killer. BeHavior needs to stop making serial killer dating apps and focus on there game so players can have a fun time in the game. OH WAIT, they don't care about players having fun so they just said "Screw our players, lets make a dating simulator!"

I want hours of my life back... can you refund that? Didn't think so...

I don't enjoy 5 minute waits for a 10-30 second match. Then stare at a hook for 2 minutes. Then back to waiting for another lobby. 

Will re-rate if they revert or fix this MMR system.

Edit:
It got worse.

(Duke Nukem Voice)
Come experience Dead By Daylight, with all the classic horror villains you've come to love! Doing such exciting things as; Michael Myers standing in the middle of the street with the first person he caught staring down anyone who approaches, or Freddy Krueger standing in the middle of the street with the first person he caught staring down anyone who approaches, Or even Nemesis from Resident Evil standing in the middle of the street with the first person he caught staring down anyone who approaches, this time with zombies.
Experience Such mind bending gameplay and tactical decisions as "Do I hold mouse click for the next 120 seconds and exit the game, or walk up and die to The Demogorgon from Stranger Things standing in the middle of the street with the first person he caught staring down anyone who approaches?"
It really flips the script on other horror games that don't have the same license purchasing power when you see icons like; Pyramid Head from the Silent Hill franchise, standing in the middle of the street with the first survivor they caught... staring down anyone who approaches. You can play with friends adding the additional tactical complexity of deciding who should be next to sit on the hook in the middle of the street to keep the killer company while the others continue holding down their mouse button.

Although the basics and mechanics of this game are very simple and can seem overly repetitive I still find myself enjoying this game in every match I play, although the mechanics are rather basic there is a large mind game going on which is where the real skill cap lies. This game can be great fun to play casually or competitively and with friends or solo.  The game has been built up a great amount over the years and is really in a solid state today and still more and more improvements come like the Stranger Things DLC that just came out this halloween.
